section.title: Export and Version
section.para: Knowledge users with Content Manager or Administrator roles can create versions or export content and access this functionality from the Task Pane, see ; Editors can export content only and access this functionality from the Short Cuts menu, . The primary purpose of creating versions is to make releases and content available to internal and external customers in release file format.

figure.title: Export and Version – Administrators and Content Managers

section.title: Export
section.para: Knowledge currently supports the generation of a SNOMED CT Release File Format 2 (RF2) release. Select the Export button, provide the information needed and select the Create Export button. An export form is presented,

When an export is initiated, several steps happen in the background before a file is packaged for download. Once the export is ready, knowledge will notify you that the file is ready for download. Click on the export message, and your browser will prompt you to download the file to your computer.

On the Create an Export modal, the user must provide the following information in the form:
Select modules - Select the modules that you want to export from. The module that you have edits in is selected by default. Select more than one by holding the CTRL key while selecting multiple modules.
Content range - Select the date range for the content you are exporting. Note that when the files are exported, the content's date stamp will be updated to the selected start date.
Generate SCTID for content with missing IDs - Select this option when SCTIDs should be added to any newly created SNOMED CT concepts that do not have SCTIDs. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Export type - SNOMED CT RF2 is selected by default. The Solor RF2 compatible release will be available in a future Knowledge release.

mediaobject.alt: Create an Export modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.

section.para:
Once export is initiated, a message
informs the user that an export is in process. When the export is complete another message is displayed and the user can download the file. The download is made available for 5 mins and then expires. If the download expires a message is displayed, see
Export
Create an Export modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.
Export Expired
Message displayed when export file has timed out. Time out is 5 mins.

section.title: Create a Version
section.para:
When content is ready to be released, a Content Manager or Administrator can create a version by selecting the Create a Version button located in the shortcuts menu or in the Export and Versions tab. A form () will appear asking for the following information:
Module location - This is where the new version module will be located in the taxonomy after creation.
Version name – the user specified name of the version module.
Content version date - This optional field will update the content modification dates of the concepts to the date selected. If it is left blank, no changes will be made to the original dates on each concept.
Content range – Select the date range for the content you want to create a version for. To better assist you, you can optionally select the "Select by version date" link to pick a date based on a previous version.
Run Classifier – Gives the user the option to run the classifier as a part of generating a version.
Perform QA Test - QA tests are necessary to ensure accurate data. The version may not be created if there is a critical QA error. You can perform the test independently before creating a version or run it in this process. If you choose to run QA in this version creation form and there are errors, the version will not be created and you will be taken to the QA results page.
Generate SCTIDs for content with missing IDs - If there are any SNOMED content with missing SCTIDs, the system can generate them for you. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Namespace - If you choose to generate SCTIDs, this is the SNOMED identifier that is provided to you by SNOMED CT.
Create and download and export file - Downloads a compressed file of all of the contents.
Save a copy to the repository - Publishes the exported file into the repository server.
This is configurable for each customer and is not configured in the Knowledge demonstration enviornment.
Export Type
The Solor RF2 comptabible export will be supported in a future Knowledge release. – SNOMED CT RF2 is supported at this time.

Select "Create Version" to begin the backend versioning process. A message is displayed to indicate the versioning process has started, see . The time to create a version will depend on the options selected, such as classification, and QA. When version creation is complete the progress table is updated, see and the results of create version are displayed, see . If a classifier, QA, or export was performed as a part of the version creation sequence, its results can be accessed through the version details.

mediaobject.alt: Create a Version modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, perform QA test, perform classification, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.

section.title: Version and Export Progress
section.para: When a Version or Export is initiated the table is updated with a new entry, see . The entries in this table will update as the Export or Version progresses.
